<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <u>Leonard

Schnitzer</u> has been the Chief Executive Officer of the Company since August

1973, and became Chairman of the Board in March 1991.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <u>Robert

W. Philip</u> has been President of the Company since March 1991.&#160; He had been a Vice President of the Company

since 1984 with responsibility for the Company's Metra Steel distribution

division from 1984 to the time of its sale in July 1990.&#160; Mr. Philip is Leonard Schnitzer's

son-in-law.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <u>Kenneth

M. Novack</u> is Executive Vice President of the Company and President of

Schnitzer Investment Corp. and certain other Schnitzer Group companies.&#160; From 1975 to 1980, he worked for the Company

as Vice President and then Executive Vice President.&#160; Mr. Novack was also President of Schnitzer Investment Corp. from

1978 to 1980.&#160; From 1981 until April

1991, he was a partner in the law firm of Ball, Janik &amp; Novack.&#160; Mr. Novack is the son-in-law of Gilbert

Schnitzer, a brother of Leonard Schnitzer.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <u>Gary

Schnitzer</u> has been Executive Vice President in charge of the Company's

California metals recycling operations since 1980.&#160; Gary Schnitzer is the son of Gilbert Schnitzer.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <u>Barry

A. Rosen</u> has been Vice President-Finance, Treasurer, and Chief Financial

Officer of the Company since 1982.&#160;

Prior to joining Schnitzer, Mr. Rosen was Chief Financial Officer of a

privately held real estate developer.&#160;

In addition, Mr. Rosen held financial management positions with Sara Lee

Corporation and was an Audit Manager with Price Waterhouse.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1 -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

</font></font>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <u>Kurt

C. Zetzsche</u> joined the Company in February 1993 as President of the Steel

Manufacturing Business.&#160; Mr. Zetzsche

has been in the steel production business since 1966.&#160; From 1990 to February 1993, he was President of Tennessee Valley

Steel, a mini-mill steel producer.&#160; From

1976 to 1989, he was President of Knoxville Iron Co., also a mini-mill steel

producer.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">Terry

L. Glucoft</font></font></u><font face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';"> joined the Company in February 1985 and

has held a number of management positions within the Metals Recycling Business,

the latest of which is Vice President of Domestic Trading where he overseas the

Northwest recycled metals operations.&#160;

Prior to joining Schnitzer Steel, Mr. Glucoft was employed by Judson

Steel Company, a steel mini-mill in California, from 1979 to 1985.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <u>Kelly

E. Lang</u> joined the Company in September 1999 as Vice President-Corporate

Controller.&#160; From 1996 to September,

1999, he was employed by Tektronix Inc. in various financial capacities, the

last of which was Vice-President, Finance for Tektronix Inc.&#146;s Color Printing

and Imaging Division.&#160; From 1994 to

1996, he was Treasurer of Crown Pacific Partners, LP.&#160; Mr. Lang was also a CPA with Price Waterhouse LLP.</font></font></p>



<font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1 -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

</font></font>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>



<p align="center" style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><a name="PartIi"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">PART II</font></font></a></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-indent:-1.0in;"><a name="Item5_MarketForRegistrantsCommon"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">ITEM

5.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; MARKET FOR

REGISTRANT'S COMMON STOCK AND RELATED STOCKHOLDER MATTERS</font></font></a></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p align="left" style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s Class A

Common Stock is traded on the Nasdaq National Market tier of the Nasdaq Stock

Market under the symbol SCHN.&#160; The

approximate number of shareholders of record on October 31, 2001 was 108.&#160; The stock has been trading since November

16, 1993.&#160; The following table sets

forth the high and low prices reported at the close of trading on the Nasdaq

Stock Market and the dividends paid per share for the periods indicated.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>

  <td width="36%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:36.14%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Shareholders&#146; equity</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:1.44%;">

  </td>

<div style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">



<hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left">



</font></font></div>





<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><sup><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">(1)</font></font></sup><font face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Includes the results of operations of

Proler International Corp. from November 29, 1996 through August 31, 1997.</font></font></p>



<p align="left" style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.25in;"><sup><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2)</font></font></sup>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Tons for ferrous recycled metals are long

tons (2,240 pounds) and for finished steel products are short tons (2,000

pounds).</p>



<p align="left" style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.25in;"><sup><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">(3)</font></font></sup>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Does not include billet sales of $4.0

million in 1998 and $1.3 million in 1997.</p>



<p align="left" style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.25in;"><sup><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">(4)</font></font></sup>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; In the first quarter of fiscal 2000, the

Company changed its method of accounting for recycled metals inventories from

Last-In, First-Out (LIFO) to First-In, First-Out (FIFO).&#160; See Note 2 to the consolidated financial

statements. The effect of the accounting change on net income as previously

reported is as follows (in millions, except per share amounts):</p>



<font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1 -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

</font></font>

  </td>

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">$</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:12.14%;">

  <p align="right" style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">(0.28</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:2.08%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">)</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:1.32%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">$</font></font></p>

  </td>

<p align="left" style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p align="left" style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p align="left" style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><a name="Item7_ManagementsDiscussionAndAnal"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">ITEM 7.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; MANAGEMENT'S

DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND</font></font></a></p>



<p align="left" style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; RESULTS OF OPERATIONS</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Results of Operations</font></font></b></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">The results of operations of the Company depend in large

part upon demand and prices for recycled metals in world markets and steel

products on the U.S. West Coast.&#160;&#160; For

example, increasing steel demand and prices led to improved profitability

during the period of fiscal 1995 through fiscal 1997.&#160; However, primarily due to the Asian financial crisis, which

severely curtailed demand and decreased prices, fiscal 1998 and 1999 results

for the Metals Recycling Business were negatively impacted.&#160; During fiscal 2000, the Company saw demand

for recycled metal rise, but unusually large supply became available in certain

of the countries that were part of the former Soviet Union, which held prices

down.&#160; In addition, domestic demand for

finished steel products was strong, but lower cost imports, primarily from

Asia, caused average prices to generally decline.&#160; In fiscal 2001, the demand for recycled metals declined in the

U.S. as domestic steel production declined; however, demand in Asia,

particularly in China, remained firm.&#160;

Prices were still somewhat held down by supplies coming out of countries

that were part of the former Soviet Union.&#160;

Demand for finished steel products declined due to the slowing U.S.

economy and competition from lower cost imports.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">The following tables set forth information regarding the

breakdown of revenues between the Company's Metals Recycling Business and Steel

Manufacturing Business, and the breakdown of income from operations between the

Metals Recycling Business, the Steel Manufacturing Business, Joint Ventures,

Corporate and eliminations.&#160; Additional

financial information relating to business segments is contained in Note 10 of

the Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1 -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

</font></font>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:1.8%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>

  </td>

 </tr>

</table>



</div>

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:1.76%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>

  </td>

 </tr>

 <tr>

  <td width="52%" valign="top" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:52.2%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Corporate Expense <sup>(2)</sup></font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:1.8%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>

  </td>

  <td width="13%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:13.56%;">

  <p align="right" style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">(8.4</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:1.78%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">)</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="13%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:13.56%;">

  <p align="right" style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">(8.4</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:1.78%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">)</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="13%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:13.56%;">

  <p align="right" style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">(7.0</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:1.76%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">)</font></font></p>

  </td>

 </tr>

 <tr>

  <td width="52%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:52.2%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Intercompany Eliminations</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:1.8%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>

  </td>

  <td width="13%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:13.56%;">

  <p align="right" style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">(0.1</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:1.78%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">)</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="13%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:13.56%;">

  <p align="right" style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">(1.0</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:1.78%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">)</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="13%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:13.56%;">

  </td>

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:1.76%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>

  </td>

 </tr>

 <tr>

  <td width="52%" valign="top" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:52.2%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Income&#160; from Operations</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:1.8%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>

  </td>

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:1.08%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">$</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:12.48%;">

  <p align="right" style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">14.1</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:1.78%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:1.08%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">$</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:12.48%;">

  <p align="right" style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">15.2</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:1.78%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:1.08%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">$</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:12.48%;">

  <p align="right" style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">3.9</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:1.76%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>

  </td>

</div>





<div style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">



<hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left">



</font></font></div>





<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><sup><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">(1)</font></font></sup><font face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Ferrous recycled metal sales from the

Metals Recycling Business to the Steel Manufacturing Business are made at a

negotiated rate per ton that is intended to approximate market.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><sup><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">(2)</font></font></sup><font face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Corporate expense consists primarily of

unallocated corporate expense for services that benefit both the </font></font><font face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';">Metals

Recycling Business<font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;"> and the Steel Manufacturing

Business.&#160; Because of this unallocated

expense, the income from operations of each segment does not reflect the income

from operations the segment would have as a stand-alone business.</font></font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<h1 style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:12.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">Fiscal 2001 Compared to

Fiscal 2000</font></font></u></b></h1>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in -.5in .0001pt 0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Revenues.</font></font></b><font face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';">&#160; Revenues for both the Metals Recycling

Business and Steel Manufacturing Business were lower as consolidated revenues

decreased $41.9 million to $291.9 million for fiscal 2001 compared with fiscal

2000.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in -.5in .0001pt 0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">The Metals Recycling Business generated

revenues of $182.4 million, before intercompany eliminations, a decrease of

$6.0 million (3%).&#160; Ferrous revenues

decreased $8.1 million (6%) to $135.3 million primarily as a result of lower

average selling prices.&#160; Ferrous volumes

decreased 24,600 tons (2%) and the average selling price of ferrous recycled

metal decreased $4 per ton to $91 per ton (4%).&#160; However, prices firmed in the fourth quarter of fiscal 2001 as

the volume of lower cost ferrous recycled metal from the countries of the

former Soviet Union diminished. The Metals Recycling Business made export

shipments aggregating 777,000 tons, an increase of 16,000 tons (2%) in fiscal

2001 compared with fiscal 2000.&#160; Demand

from Asia, particularly China, has remained strong and pushed ferrous export

tons higher in fiscal 2001 compared with fiscal 2000.&#160; Because of the softening U. S. economy domestic third-party

ferrous tonnage decreased 108,000 ton (44%).&#160;

Sales to the Company&#146;s Steel Manufacturing Business increased 13% to

566,000 tons due to an increase in melt shop production at the Company&#146;s steel

mini-mill.&#160; Nonferrous revenues

increased $3.8 million (10%) to $42.4 million due primarily to higher volumes.

Improvements in the processes used to extract metal from the automobile shredding

process and a temporary backlog of unprocessed shredder residue provided higher

volumes of nonferrous metals, increasing sales volume by 18.2 million pounds

(19%) in fiscal 2001 compared with fiscal 2000.&#160; The average nonferrous selling price decreased $0.03 per pound

(8%) due to slowing demand caused primarily by the slowdown in the U.S.

economy.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in -.5in .0001pt 0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1 -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

</font></font>



<p align="left" style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:0pt;">The Steel Manufacturing Business recognized revenues

of $159.4 million in fiscal 2001, a decrease of 17% from revenues recognized in

the prior year. Sales of finished steel products declined 18% to 546,000 tons

while the average selling price per ton increased $3 per ton (1%) to $292 per

ton.&#160; The decrease in sales volumes came

from all major product lines with the exception of reinforcing bar, for which

sales volume approximated prior year levels.&#160;

The slight increase in the average sales price per ton is primarily due

to the change in product mix.&#160; During

fiscal 2001, the Company focused on selling those products, such as reinforcing

bar, which have higher margins.&#160; The

slowing U.S. economy, as well as competition from lower cost steel imports,

continues to impact sales volumes and prices.&#160;

On June 5, 2001, President Bush asked the U.S. International Trade

Commission to investigate the effects of steel imports on the domestic steel

industry under Section 201 of the 1974 Trade Act. The Commission has determined

that some steel imports are a threat to domestic steel producers, and the

President could impose safeguard restrictions on steel imports to aid the steel

industry.&#160; It is expected the President

will rule on the safeguard restrictions, if any, by the end of 2001.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in -.5in .0001pt 0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Cost of Goods Sold</font></font></b><font face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';">.<b><font style="font-weight:bold;">&#160; </font></b>Consolidated cost of goods sold

decreased $36.1 million (12%) to $260.5 million and was 89% of revenues,

consistent with fiscal 2000.&#160; However,

gross profit decreased $5.8 million (16%) to $31.4 million.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">Cost of goods sold for

the Metals Recycling Business decreased $1.2 million (1%) to $159.4 million

before intercompany eliminations.&#160; Cost

of sales per ferrous ton decreased as demand for processed metal declined, allowing

the Company to lower the price paid for unprocessed metal.&#160; Gross profit decreased $4.3 million compared

with the prior fiscal year as the decline in the cost of unprocessed ferrous

metal was more than offset by a decrease in the average selling price per ton

for ferrous recycled metal.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">Cost of goods sold for

the Steel Manufacturing Business decreased $30.8 million reflecting the lower

sales volume for fiscal 2001 compared with fiscal 2000.&#160; Cost of sales per ton, excluding billets,

increased $4 per ton (1%) compared with the prior fiscal year.&#160; The increase was primarily due to decreased

production volume, that spread fixed costs over fewer tons, and a higher volume

of sales to California, which have higher freight and distribution costs than

sales in the Pacific Northwest.&#160; This

increased cost of sales per ton resulted in a decrease in gross profit of $2.2

million (11%) in fiscal 2001 compared with fiscal 2000.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Income from Joint Ventures.&#160;

</font></font></b><font face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';">The Company&#146;s joint ventures&#146; revenues and results of operations

were as follows (in thousands):</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="84%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:84.12%;">

 <tr>

  <td width="68%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:68.2%;">

  <p align="center" style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-align:center;text-indent:-10.0pt;">&nbsp;</p>

  </td>

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:1.96%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>

  </td>

  <td width="27%" colspan="5" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:27.9%;">

  <p align="center" style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Year

  Ended August 31,</font></font></b></p>

  </td>

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:1.94%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>

  </td>

 </tr>

 <tr>

  <td width="68%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:68.2%;">

  <p align="center" style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-align:center;text-indent:-10.0pt;">&nbsp;</p>

  </td>

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:1.96%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>

  </td>

  <td width="12%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:12.96%;">

  <p align="center" style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2001</font></font></b></p>

  </td>

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:1.96%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>

  </td>

 </tr>

</table>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">The Joint Ventures in the Metals

Recycling Business predominantly sell recycled ferrous and nonferrous

metals.&#160; The decrease in revenues

recognized by these joint ventures is attributable to lower average ferrous selling

prices partially offset by an increase in tonnage shipped.&#160; Shipments of ferrous metal processed by the

joint ventures increased to 3.1 million tons for the year ended August 31, 2001

from 2.8 million tons in the prior year.&#160;

The average selling price of ferrous recycled metal decreased during

that period to $86 per ton from $108 per ton, predominantly due to competition

from the countries of the former Soviet Union as well as lower demand from U.S.

steel mills.&#160; The lower ferrous revenues

were partially offset by higher nonferrous revenues.&#160; This increase was due to greater nonferrous metal recovery from

higher ferrous volumes processed and improved processes for the extraction of

nonferrous metals.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1 -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

</font></font>



<p align="left" style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">In fiscal 2001, the Company&#146;s share of income from

Joint Ventures in the Metals Recycling Business increased to $6.5 million due

to increased sales volume, increased margins and more efficient

operations.&#160; The Company&#146;s joint

ventures with Hugo Neu Corporation, which earned the majority of the income, instituted

EVA concurrently with the Company.&#160; This

led to improved operational efficiencies and increased profitability.&#160; Also, the Hugo Neu joint ventures were able

to lower buying prices as selling prices declined.&#160; The Company also benefited by $0.9 million to reflect the

Company&#146;s share of LIFO inventory adjustments. In comparison, the results for

fiscal 2000 were adversely affected by a $1.1 million LIFO inventory

adjustment.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">Both revenues and income

from the Joint Venture Suppliers of Metal increased from fiscal 2000 to fiscal

2001 primarily due to increased sales by the Company&#146;s self-service auto

dismantling joint venture.&#160; Increased

sales prices and lower interest costs drove the improvements.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Interest Expense.&#160; </font></font></b><font face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';">Interest

expense decreased $2.3 million due to lower average borrowings and lower

average interest rates.&#160; The Company

averaged borrowings of $81.5 million in fiscal 2001 compared to $107.4 million

in fiscal 2000.&#160; The decrease in average

borrowings reflects a substantial decrease in borrowings in the fourth quarter

of fiscal 2000 due primarily to inventory reductions then and during the first

half of fiscal 2001, as well as a $7.5 million improvement in cash flow from

the Company&#146;s joint ventures.&#160; This

lower borrowing level continued through fiscal 2001.&#160; The average interest rate for fiscal 2001 was 5.8% compared with

6.3% for fiscal 2000.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Gain (Loss) on Sale of Assets.&#160; </font></font></b><font face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';">Fiscal 2001 gain (loss) on sale of assets

improved by $1.5 million.&#160; The increase

is mainly attributable to the fact that last year&#146;s amount included a loss of

$1.0 million on the sale of a vessel used to export recycled metal.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Other Income.</font></font></b><font face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';"> Other income decreased $2.3 million in

fiscal 2001 compared with fiscal 2000 primarily due to a $1.6 million change in

gains and losses recognized on trust fund assets of a nonqualified supplemental

retirement plan for certain Company executives.&#160; Other income was also adversely impacted by lower average

interest rates on advances and notes to joint venture partners, resulting in a

decrease of $0.2 million.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Income Tax Provision. </font></font></b><font face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';">As part of

the 1996 acquisition of Proler International, Corp. (Proler), the Company

acquired $31.4 million of federal net operating loss carryforwards (NOLs).&#160; Prior to fiscal 2000, federal tax law placed

limitations on the source of the income that could be offset by the NOLs.&#160; Accordingly, the Company was not able to

record the potential tax benefits from the NOLs because of the lack of

certainty in being able to realize these benefits.&#160; In fiscal 2000, federal tax law was amended, which allowed the

Company to utilize the NOLs to offset substantially all of its taxable

income.&#160; As a result, in fiscal 2000,

the Company utilized $8.5 million of NOLs in determining its effective tax

rate, which included a catch-up of $6.2 million of NOLs.&#160; This change in tax law resulted in an

effective tax of 6% in fiscal 2000.&#160;

During fiscal 2001, the Company continued to benefit from the

utilization of $2.4 million of NOLs, which was one of the primary reasons the

effective rate was only 30% as compared to the statutory rate of 34%.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p align="left" style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">As noted above, Federal income tax law limits the

Company&#146;s use of NOLs to $2.4 million per year.&#160; Unused NOLs may be carried forward and used in subsequent fiscal

years, though they will ultimately expire in fiscal years 2007 through 2012, if

not used by then.&#160; Subject to the annual

limit, there remains at August 31, 2001 $20.1 million of Proler NOLs that may

be used in future years before they expire.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<h1 style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:12.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">Fiscal 2000 Compared to

Fiscal 1999</font></font></u></b></h1>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">
<!-- SEQ.=1 -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

</font></font></b>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Revenues.&#160; </font></font></b><font face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';">Revenues for

both the Metals Recycling Business and the Steel Manufacturing Business

increased resulting in an overall improvement in consolidated revenues of $68.8

million to $333.8 million for fiscal 2000 compared with fiscal 1999.&#160; The strengthening Asian economies had a

particularly positive impact on volume and prices for the Metals Recycling

Business in fiscal 2000.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p align="left" style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Metals Recycling Business generated revenues of $188.4 million,

before intercompany eliminations, an increase of $51.3 million (37%).&#160; Ferrous revenues increased $41.7 million

(41%) to $143.4 million as a result of both higher volumes and higher average

selling prices, both of which were primarily caused by the rebounding Asian

economies.&#160; Ferrous volumes increased

282,000 tons (23%) while the average selling price of ferrous recycled metal

increased $12 per ton (14%) to $95 per ton.&#160;

The Metals Recycling Business made export shipments aggregating 761,000

tons during fiscal 2000 compared with export shipments totaling 491,000 tons during

the prior year.&#160; Domestic third-party

tonnage increased by 27% to 247,000 tons.&#160;

Sales to the Company&#146;s Steel Business decreased by 8% to 498,000

tons.&#160; Nonferrous revenues increased

$12.6 million (49%) to $38.6 million due to higher volumes and higher average

selling prices.&#160; Increased exports and a

strong domestic market were primarily responsible for the nonferrous

improvements, as well as the Metals Recycling Business&#146; ability to produce more

nonferrous products.&#160; Nonferrous volumes

increased 21.7 million pounds (29%) and the average selling price increased

$0.05 per pound (14%).</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p align="left" style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:0pt;">The Steel Manufacturing Business recognized revenues

for fiscal 2000 of $192.4 million, an increase of 11% from revenues recognized

in the prior year.&#160; Although the volume

of finished steel products sold increased, the average selling price per ton

declined.&#160; Sales of finished steel

products increased 17% to 666,000 tons as strong demand enabled the Company to

substantially increase production and sales of wire rod products.&#160; However, the average selling price declined

$14 per ton (5%) to $289 per ton.&#160; The

decline in average selling prices is primarily attributable to the dumping of

lower priced steel products by Asian companies on the West Coast.&#160; The decline in the average selling price is

also partially due to a change in product mix.&#160;

During fiscal 2000, the Steel Manufacturing Business shipped

proportionately more lower-priced products (principally wire rod) than in the

prior year.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Cost of Goods Sold.&#160; </font></font></b><font face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';">Consolidated

cost of goods sold increased $55.7 million (23%) to $296.6 million and

decreased as a percentage of revenues to 89%, compared with 91% in fiscal

1999.&#160; Gross profit increased by $13.1

million (54%) to $37.2 million.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">The Metals Recycling Business&#146; cost of

goods sold increased $37.1 million to $161.0 million before intercompany

eliminations.&#160; Cost of sales per ferrous

ton increased due to increased foreign demand for processed metal that directly

impacted the demand for and cost of unprocessed metals.&#160; The increase in the cost of unprocessed

metal was more than offset by the increase in the average selling price

increasing gross profit $5.0 million compared with the previous fiscal

year.&#160; Income from operations for fiscal

2000 increased $13.0 million compared with fiscal 1999, primarily due to the

stronger Asian economies.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">Cost of goods sold for the Steel

Manufacturing Business increased $19.0 million (12%).&#160; Cost of sales per ton, excluding billets, declined by $13 per ton

primarily due to increased production that spread the allocation of fixed costs

over more tons.&#160; Lower average selling

prices more than offset this decline in operating costs per ton, but increased

sales volume resulted in a gross profit of $10.7 million which was $0.7 million

higher than in fiscal 1999.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Selling and Administrative Expenses.&#160; </font></font></b><font face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';">Selling and

administrative expenses increased $2.8 million to $26.5 million. Of this

increase, $1.6 million was due to annual salary merit increases and additional

bonus accruals based on significant improvement in results during fiscal 2000.&#160; Fiscal 2000 expenses also included $0.4

million in write-offs of uncollectible debts.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">
<!-- SEQ.=1 -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

</font></font></b>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Income from Joint Ventures.&#160;

</font></font></b><font face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';">The Company&#146;s joint ventures&#146; revenues and results of

operations were as follows (in thousands):</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>

 <tr>

  <td width="59%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:59.76%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">Joint

  Ventures in the Metals Recycling Business</font></font></p>

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:2.48%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:1.1%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="15%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:15.34%;">

  <p align="right" style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">303,014</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:2.4%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:2.48%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:2.4%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>

  <td width="59%" valign="top" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:59.76%;">
