  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>

  </td>

  <td width="39%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:39.48%;">

  <p align="right" style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">71</font></font></p>

  </td>

 </tr>

 <tr>

  <td width="46%" valign="top" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:46.72%;">

  <p align="center" style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-align:center;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">2006</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="13%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:13.8%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>

  </td>

  <td width="39%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:39.48%;">

  <p align="right" style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">71</font></font></p>

  </td>

 </tr>

 <tr>

  <td width="46%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:46.72%;">

  <p align="center" style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-align:center;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">Thereafter</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="13%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:13.8%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>

  </td>

  <td width="39%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:39.48%;">

  <p align="right" style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">7,726</font></font></p>

  </td>

 </tr>

 <tr>

  <td width="46%" valign="top" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:46.72%;">

  <p align="center" style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-align:center;text-indent:-10.0pt;">&nbsp;</p>

  </td>

  <td width="13%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:13.8%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>

  </td>

  <td width="5%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:5.58%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="33%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:33.92%;">

  <p align="right" style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">93,966</font></font></p>

  </td>

 </tr>

</table>



</div>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Note 5 - Environmental Liabilities:</font></font></b></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p align="left" style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">Federal and state

environmental regulatory agencies have been investigating potential

contamination of a 5.5 mile stretch of the Willamette River in Portland, Oregon

referred to as the Portland Harbor.&#160; In

December 2000, the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) named the

Portland Harbor a Superfund site. However, the precise nature and extent of any

clean-up of the site, the parties to be involved, and the process to be

followed for such a clean-up have not yet been determined.&#160; The Oregon Department of Environmental

Quality (DEQ) has requested operating history and other information from numerous

persons and entities which own or conduct operations on properties adjacent to

or upland from the Portland Harbor.&#160; The

DEQ has contacted Schnitzer Investment Corp. (SIC), a related party, from whom

the Company leases its metals recycling and deep water terminal facility in

Portland, Oregon, and requested that SIC perform a voluntary preliminary

investigation of that property.&#160; SIC has

agreed to perform an investigation of the property.&#160; The Company is obligated under its lease with SIC to bear all

costs relating to the investigation and remediation of the property.&#160; Also, Crawford Street Corporation, a

subsidiary of the Company, owns property adjacent to the Portland Harbor and

has been requested by DEQ to perform a voluntary preliminary investigation of

its property. While the cost of the investigation of these properties is not

expected to be material, no estimate has been made as to the cost of

remediation, if any.&#160; Accordingly, no

accrual for the remediation had been established as of August 31, 2001.</font></font></p>



<p align="left" style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p align="left" style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">When the Company

acquired Manufacturing Management, Inc. (MMI) in March 1995, an environmental

reserve of $25.0 million was included in MMI&#146;s balance sheet prior to its

acquisition by the Company.&#160; This

reserve was carried over to the Company&#146;s balance sheet and at August 31, 2001

aggregated $17.7 million.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p align="left" style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">General Metals of Tacoma (GMT), a subsidiary of MMI,

owns and operates a metals recycling facility located in the State of

Washington on the Hylebos Waterway, a part of Commencement Bay, which is the

subject of an ongoing environmental investigation and remediation project by

the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) under the Comprehensive

Environmental Response, Compensation and Liability Act (CERCLA).&#160; GMT and well over 60 other parties were

named potentially responsible parties (PRPs) for the investigation and clean up

of contaminated sediment along the Hylebos Waterway.&#160; GMT and five other PRPs have voluntarily entered into an

Administrative Order on Consent with the EPA to fund a pre-remedial study of

sediment contamination and remediation alternatives.&#160; Although the study is now complete and the Company has paid for

its share of the study, there are a variety of uncertainties regarding the

clean-up of this site, which impact the Company&#146;s ability to estimate its

future potential liabilities.&#160; A final

plan for remediation of the Hylebos Waterway has not yet been agreed to.&#160; Additionally, significant uncertainties

exist regarding the Company&#146;s share of the costs to remediate this site.&#160; The environmental liabilities above include

the Company&#146;s estimate of its liabilities related to this site based on

information currently available.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">In 1996, prior to the Company&#146;s acquisition of Proler

International Corp. (Proler), Proler recorded a liability of $9.8 million for

the probable costs to remediate its wholly owned properties.&#160; The Company carried over the aggregate

reserve to its financial statements upon acquiring Proler and $</font></font><font face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';">5.2 <font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">million remained outstanding on August 31, 2001.

Also, Proler&#146;s joint ventures recorded additional liabilities of $4.1 million

for the probable costs to remediate their properties in 1996 prior to the

Company&#146;s acquisition of Proler.</font></font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1 -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

</font></font>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Between 1982 and 1987, MRI Corporation (MRI), a wholly

owned subsidiary of Proler, operated a tin can shredding and detinning facility

in Tampa, Florida.&#160; In 1989 and 1992,

the EPA conducted preliminary site investigations of this property and, in

December 1996, added the site to the &#147;National Priorities List&#148;.&#160; MRI and Proler, along with several other

parties have been named as PRPs for the site by the EPA. Proler included the

probable costs associated with this site in the aforementioned reserve.

Additionally, Proler and this subsidiary have been named or identified as PRPs

at several other sites.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">As part of the

Proler acquisition, the Company became a fifty-percent owner of Hugo Neu-Proler

Company (HNP).&#160; HNP has agreed, as part

of its 1996 lease renewal with the Port of Los Angeles, to be responsible for a

multi-year, phased remedial clean-up project involving certain environmental

conditions on its metals recycling facility at its Terminal Island site in Los

Angeles, California, to be completed by the year 2002.&#160; Remediation will include limited excavation

and treatment of contaminated soils, paving, installation of a stormwater

management system, construction of a noise barrier and perimeter wall around

the facility, and groundwater monitoring.&#160;

The probable costs to remediate this property are included in the

aforementioned reserve.</font></font></p>



<p align="left" style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">Metals

Recycling LLC (Metals) is a scrap metals processing business with locations in

Rhode Island and Massachusetts.&#160; The

members of Metals are one of the Company&#146;s Proler joint ventures and Metals

Recycling, Inc.&#160; On June 9, 1999, the

Rhode Island Department of Environmental Management (DEM) issued a Notice of

Violation (NOV) against Metals alleging Metals had violated federal and state

regulations relating to the storage, management, and transportation of

hazardous waste and imposed an administrative penalty of $0.7 million.&#160; Metals has filed an answer to the NOV in

which it denied the allegations and requested an adjudicatory hearing.&#160; In July 1999, the DEM issued a NOV to Rhode

Island Resource Recovery Corporation (RIRRC), which included a civil penalty of

$0.3 million, relating to the alleged disposal of hazardous waste by Metals at

a landfill operated by RIRRC.&#160; Metals

and RIRRC have denied the DEM's allegations.&#160;

RIRRC has settled with DEM and RIRRC and Metals are discussing a

possible contribution by Metals to RIRRC with respect to that settlement.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p align="left" style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">In January of 1999, federal and state officials

searched Metal's Johnston, Rhode Island and Worcester, Massachusetts

facilities.&#160; Metals has been advised

that the search was part of a state criminal investigation into possible

violations of state and federal hazardous waste programs and a Rhode Island

statute that prohibits the disposal of out-of-state solid waste at the landfill

operated by RIRRC.&#160; A grand jury has

been empanelled to consider the allegations.&#160;

No proceedings have been commenced against Metals or its officers.&#160; The Company believes Metals has substantial

defenses to the alleged violations.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">The Company considers various factors

when estimating its environmentalliabilities.&#160; Adjustments to the liabilities are made when

additional information becomes available that affects the estimated costs to

remediate.&#160; The factors, which the

Company considers in its recognition and measurement of environmental

liabilities, include the following:</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font></font><font face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Current regulations both at the time the

reserve is established and during the course of the clean-up which specify

standards for acceptable remediation;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font></font><font face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Information about the site, which becomes

available as the site is studied and remediated;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font></font><font face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; The professional judgment of both

senior-level internal staff and external consultants who take into account

similar, recent instances of environmental remediation issues, among other

considerations;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font></font><font face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Technologies available that can be used

for remediation;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font></font><font face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font></font><font face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';">The number

and financial condition of other potentially responsible parties and the extent

of their responsibility for the remediation.</font></font></p>



<p align="left" style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p align="left" style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the fiscal year ended August 31, 1999, the

Company lowered cost of goods sold by $1.9 million for the reversal of

environmental reserves related to various properties.</font></font></p>



<font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1 -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

</font></font>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Note 6 - Income Taxes:</font></font></b></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p align="left" style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">The provision for

income taxes is as follows (in thousands):</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<div align="center">

  <td width="56%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:56.52%;">

  <p align="center" style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-align:center;text-indent:-10.0pt;">&nbsp;</p>

  </td>

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:2.08%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>

  </td>

  <td width="39%" colspan="8" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:39.44%;">

  <p align="center" style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Year Ended August 31,</font></font></b></p>

  </td>

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:1.94%;">

 <tr>

  <td width="56%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:56.52%;">

  <p align="center" style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-align:center;text-indent:-10.0pt;">&nbsp;</p>

  </td>

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:2.08%;">

  </td>

  <td width="11%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:11.76%;">

  <p align="center" style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">2001</font></font></b></p>

  </td>

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-top:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:2.04%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>

  </td>

  <td width="11%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:solid windowtext .5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:11.8%;">

  <p align="center" style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">2000</font></font></b></p>

  </td>

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-top:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:2.04%;">

  </td>

  <td width="11%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:solid windowtext .5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:11.82%;">

  <p align="center" style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">1999</font></font></b></p>

  </td>

 <tr>

  <td width="56%" valign="top" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:56.52%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Current:</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:2.08%;">

assets and liabilities are as follows (in thousands):</font></font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">The reasons for

the difference between the effective income tax rate and the statutory federal

income tax rate are as follows:</font></font></p>

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">%</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="14%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:14.26%;">

  <p align="right" style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">55</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:2.34%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">%</font></font></p>

  </td>

 </tr>

</table>



</div>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1 -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

</font></font>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">Federal

tax law places annual limits on an acquiring corporation&#146;s use of an acquired

corporation&#146;s net operating losses (NOLs) and credits.&#160; Unused NOLs and credits can be carried

forward to future years.&#160; When Proler

was acquired in 1996, it had NOLs of $31.4 million and minimum tax credits of

$0.7.&#160; The law limits the Company&#146;s use

of the Proler NOLs to an annual $2.4 million and, to the extent unused, will

expire in years 2007 through 2012.&#160;

Similar limitations apply to the Proler minimum tax credits, though they

can be carried forward indefinitely.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">When Proler was acquired, pre-1999

Federal tax law placed a further restriction on the Company&#146;s use of the NOLs

such that they could only be used to reduce taxable income of the acquired

Proler entities.&#160; This made ultimate

realization of the NOLs so uncertain that a valuation allowance was established

to offset the entire NOL deferred tax asset of $31.4 million.&#160; Under this constraint, the Company only

recognized $.4 million of tax benefit from release of the valuation allowance

prior to fiscal 2000.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p align="left" style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:0pt;">A 1999 change to Federal tax law, however, now

allows the Company to use the remaining annual $2.4 million NOL increments to

reduce taxable income from all sources, not just from the acquired Proler

entities.&#160; (A similar change liberalized

use of the minimum tax credits, too).&#160;

The Company believed that it was more likely than not that it would

utilize a portion of the Proler NOL in the amounts of $8.5 million in fiscal

2000 and $2.4 million in fiscal 2001, and accordingly has released the

valuation allowance and recognized the corresponding tax benefit.&#160; Tax benefit for the remaining $20.1 million

remains unrecognized as of August 31, 2001.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Note 7 - Related Party Transactions:</font></font></b></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Certain shareholders of the Company own significant

interest in, or are related to owners of, the entities discussed below.&#160; As such, these entities are considered

related parties for financial reporting purposes.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Transactions Affecting Cost of Goods Sold and Other

Operating Expenses</font></font></i></p>



<p align="left" style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company

charters several vessels from related companies to transport recycled metal to

foreign markets.&#160; The number of vessels

chartered varies from year to year depending on the availability of their

vessels.&#160; Charges incurred for these

charters were $13.5 million, $9.4 million, and $4.6 million for 2001, 2000, and

1999, respectively.&#160; In 1993, the

Company signed a five-year time-charter agreement for one vessel which expired

in June 1998.&#160; The agreement guaranteed

the ship owner a residual market value of $2.5 million at the end of the

time-charter.&#160; Upon expiration of the

time charter, the Company paid the guaranteed residual and entered into an

additional five-year time charter.&#160; The

Company accounted for the transaction as a capital lease.&#160; This vessel was sold during fiscal 2000

which resulted in a $1.0 million loss.&#160;

See Note 12.&#160; The Company entered

into two additional seven-year time charters in May 1995 for other vessels.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p align="left" style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company

purchased recycled metals from its joint venture operations totaling $12.1

million, $14.7 million, and $11.0 million in 2001, 2000, and 1999,

respectively.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p align="left" style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company leases

certain land and buildings from a related real estate company under operating

leases.&#160; The following table summarizes

the lease terms, annual rents and future minimum rents (in thousands):</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="34%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:34.24%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>

  </td>

  <td width="14%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:14.48%;">

  <p align="right" style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">91,428</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:2.74%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="14%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:14.48%;">

  <p align="right" style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;">&nbsp;</p>

  </td>

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:2.74%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="14%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:14.48%;">

  <p align="right" style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">91,428</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:2.68%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>

  </td>

 </tr>

</table>



</div>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p align="left" style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">Rent expense was

$1.7 million, $1.4 million, and $1.6 million, for 2001, 2000, and 1999,

respectively.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">The rent for the Metals Recycling Business&#146;s Portland

facility will be adjusted in 2003 and every 15 years thereafter to market

rates.&#160; In 2008 and every five years

thereafter, except in the year of a market rate adjustment, the rent will be

adjusted based on the Consumer and Producer Price Indices.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Transactions Affecting Selling and Administrative Expenses</font></font></i></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">The Company performs some administrative services and

provides operation and maintenance of management information systems for

certain related parties.&#160; These services

are charged to the related parties based upon cost plus a 15% margin for

overhead and profit.&#160; These

administrative charges totaled $1.1</font></font><font face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';"> million for each of the last three years<font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">.</font></font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Transactions Affecting Other Income (Expense)</font></font></i></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">The vessels discussed above are periodically

sub-chartered to third parties.&#160; In this

case, a related shipping agency company acts as the Company&#146;s agent in the

collection of income and payment of expenses related to sub-charter

activities.&#160; In fiscal 2001, there was

no subcharted activity.&#160; For the years

ended August 31, 2000, and 1999, charges incurred for these sub-charters

aggregated $0.3 million, and $3.3 million, offset by income of $0.2 million,

and $2.9 million, respectively.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Included in other assets are </font></font><font face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';">$1.7 million

and<font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;"> $2.2 million of notes receivable from

joint venture partners at August 31, 2001 and 2000, respectively.&#160; The Company records interest income on

certain of these notes and advances to joint ventures.&#160; This income totaled $2.0 million, $2.2

million, and $1.5 million for fiscal years 2001, 2000 and 1999, respectively.</font></font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Note 8 - Employee Benefits:</font></font></b></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">In accordance with union agreements, the Company

contributed to union pension plans $2.6 million, $2.3 million, and $2.0

million, in fiscal 2001, 2000, and 1999, respectively.&#160; These are multi-employer plans and,

consequently, the Company is unable to determine its relative portion of or estimate

its future liability under the plans.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">The Company has several defined contribution plans

covering nonunion employees.&#160; The

pension cost related to these plans totaled $1.1 million, $1.1 million, and

$1.0 million for fiscal 2001, 2000, and 1999, respectively.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">For certain nonunion employees, the Company also

maintains a defined benefit pension plan.&#160;

The Company has funded the maximum contribution deductible for federal

income tax purposes.&#160;&#160; The following

table sets forth the change in benefit obligation, change in plan assets and

funded status at August 31, 2001 and 2000 in accordance with SFAS 132,

Employer&#146;s Disclosure About Pensions and Other Postretirement Benefits (in

thousands):</font></font></p>



<font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1 -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

</font></font>

<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1 -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

</font></font>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">The

Company has adopted a nonqualified supplemental retirement plan for certain

executives.&#160; A restricted trust fund has

been established and invested in life insurance policies which can be used for

plan benefits, but which are subject to claims of general creditors.&#160; The trust fund and deferred compensation

expense are classified as other assets.&#160;

The status of this plan is summarized as follows (in thousands):</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<div align="center">



<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="90%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:90.0%;">

 <tr>

  <td width="61%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:61.38%;">

  <p align="center" style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-align:center;text-indent:-10.0pt;">&nbsp;</p>

  </td>

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:2.16%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>

  </td>

  <td width="34%" colspan="8" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:34.38%;">

  <p align="center" style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">August 31,</font></font></b></p>

  </td>

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:2.06%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>

  </td>

 </tr>

 <tr>

 <tr height="0">

  <td width="398" style="border:none;"></td>

  <td width="13" style="border:none;"></td>

  <td width="8" style="border:none;"></td>

  <td width="58" style="border:none;"></td>

  <td width="13" style="border:none;"></td>

  <td width="8" style="border:none;"></td>

  <td width="58" style="border:none;"></td>

  <td width="13" style="border:none;"></td>

  <td width="8" style="border:none;"></td>

  <td width="58" style="border:none;"></td>

  <td width="13" style="border:none;"></td>

 </tr>

</table>



</div>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p align="left" style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">The trust fund

assets experienced stock market gains and losses, which are included in other

income (expense).&#160; During fiscal 2001

and 2000, the Company recognized gains (losses) totaling $(0.7 million) and

$0.9 million respectively.&#160; No gain or

loss was recognized in fiscal 1999.</font></font></p>



<p align="left" style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p align="left" style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">When the Company

acquired Proler, it assumed a liability for deferred compensation payable to

certain ex-employees of Proler.&#160; As of

August 31, 2001 and 2000, the remaining liability aggregated $0.7 million and

$1.1 million, respectively.&#160; These

amounts are included in other long-term liabilities in the accompanying

consolidated balance sheet.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Note 9 - Stock Incentive Plan:</font></font></b></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p align="left" style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company has

adopted a stock incentive plan for employees, consultants and directors of the

Company.&#160; The plan covers 1,200,000

shares of Class A common stock.&#160; All

options have a ten-year term and, except for options granted in fiscal 1999 and

2001, become exercisable for 20% of the shares covered by the option on each of

the first five anniversaries of the grant.&#160;

The options granted in fiscal 1999 became fully exercisable on the first

anniversary of the grant.&#160; The options

granted in fiscal 2001 become exercisable as follows: 33% after one year from

the date of grant, 66% after two years from the date of grant, and 100% after

two and one-half years from the date of grant.&#160;

The vesting periods for these options varied from the standard because

the Company granted them to certain employees in lieu of annual salary

revisions.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">The Company records stock-based

compensation under the provisions of Accounting Principles Board Opinion No.

25, &#147;Accounting for Stock Issued to Employees&#148; (APB 25) and related

Interpretations.&#160; An alternative method

of accounting exists under Statement of Financial Accounting Standards No. 123,

&#147;Accounting for Stock-Based Compensation,&#148; (SFAS 123) which requires the use of

option valuation models.&#160; Under APB 25,

because the exercise price of the Company&#146;s employee stock options equaled the

market price of the underlying stock on the date of grant, no compensation

expense is recognized.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p align="left" style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:0pt;">Pro forma information for fiscal years 2001, 2000,

and 1999 regarding net income and earnings per share is required by SFAS 123

and has been determined as if the Company had accounted for its employee stock

options under the fair value method of that Statement.&#160; The fair value for these awards was

estimated at the date of grant using the Black-Scholes option pricing model

with the following assumptions:</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:0pt;">For purposes of pro forma disclosures, the estimated

fair value of the options is amortized to expense over the options&#146; vesting

periods.&#160; The effects on results of

operations and earnings per share are not expected to be indicative of the

effects on results of operations or earnings per share in future years.&#160; The Company&#146;s pro forma information follows </font>(in

thousands, except per share amounts)</font><font style="letter-spacing:0pt;">:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p align="left" style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:0pt;">Exercise prices for options outstanding as of August

31, 2001 ranged from $12.00 to $25.00.&#160;

The weighted-average remaining contractual life of those options is 7.1

years.</font></font></p>



<p align="left" style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p align="left" style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:0pt;">During fiscal 2001, the Company also issued 64,196

options to a consultant.&#160; The options

were fully vested as of September 15, 2001 and expire on September 15,

2005.&#160; The exercise price is $17.42 per

share.&#160; The Company recorded an expense

of $0.2 million in fiscal 2001 related to this transaction.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1 -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

</font></font></b>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Note 10 - Segment Information:</font></font></b></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">The Company operates in

two industry segments: metal processing and recycling (Metals Recycling

Business) and mini-mill steel manufacturing (Steel Manufacturing

Business).&#160; Additionally, the Company is

a partner in joint ventures, which are either in the metals recycling business

or are suppliers of unprocessed metals.&#160;

The Company also considers these to be separate segments because they

are managed separately.&#160; These joint

ventures are accounted for using the equity method.&#160; As such, the operating information provided below related to the

joint ventures is shown separately from consolidated information, except for

the Company&#146;s equity in the net income of, investment in, and advances to the

joint ventures.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">The Metals Recycling Business buys and

processes ferrous <font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">metals </font>for sale to

foreign and other domestic steel producers or their representatives and to the

Steel Manufacturing Business.&#160; The

Metals Recycling Business also purchases ferrous metals from other processors

for shipment directly to the Steel Manufacturing Business. Intersegment sales

from the Metals Recycling Business to the Steel Manufacturing Business are

transferred at a negotiated market rate per ton and are eliminated in

consolidation.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">The Steel Manufacturing Business produces

rebar, merchant bar, wire rod, coiled rebar and other specialty products.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">The Joint Ventures in the Metals

Recycling Business are also engaged in buying, processing and selling primarily

ferrous metal.&#160; Recycled metals are sold

to foreign and domestic steel mills.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">The Joint Venture Suppliers of Metals

include two predominant operations.&#160; One

joint venture operates self-service used auto parts yards.&#160; The Company purchases substantially all of

the auto bodies which come from these yards.&#160;

Another joint venture is an industrial plant demolition contractor.&#160; This joint venture dismantles industrial

plants, performs environmental remediation and sells recovered metals and

machinery.&#160; The Company purchases

substantially all of the ferrous <font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">recycled

metals </font>generated by this joint venture.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">The information provided below is

obtained from internal information that is provided to the Company&#146;s chief

operating decision-maker for the purpose of corporate management. The Company

does not allocate corporate interest income and expense, income taxes or other

income and expenses related to corporate activity to its operating

segments.&#160; Assets and capital

expenditures are not shown for the joint ventures as management does not use

that information to allocate resources or assess performance.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>

<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p align="left" style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:0pt;">The Joint Ventures in the Metals Recycling Business

do not maintain revenues by geographic area and it would be impracticable to

provide such disclosure.&#160; Sales by the

Joint Venture Suppliers of Metals are all made to customers in the United

States.&#160; See Note 7 regarding the

Company&#146;s purchases from its joint ventures.</font></font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p align="left" style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:0pt;">Income from operations from the joint ventures

represents the Company&#146;s equity in the net income of these entities.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>

  <p align="center" style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Year Ended August 31,</font></font></b></p>

  </td>

  <p align="right" style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">10,732</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:2.02%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:1.02%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">$</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:12.28%;">

  <p align="right" style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">11,986</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:2.0%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>

  </td>

 </tr>

</table>



</div>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">In fiscal years 2001 and 2000, one

customer accounted for 10% and 15% of the Company&#146;s consolidated revenues,

respectively.&#160; No individual customer

accounted for greater than ten percent of the Company&#146;s consolidated revenues

in fiscal year 1999.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p align="left" style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:0pt;">The Joint Ventures in the Metals Recycling Business

have significant customers.&#160; During

fiscal 2001, no single customer accounted for more than 10% of combined

revenues for these joint ventures.&#160;

During fiscal 2000, one customer accounted for 22% of combined revenues

for these joint ventures.&#160; During fiscal

1999, one customer accounted for 17% and another customer accounted for 13% of

combined revenues.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1 -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

</font></font></b>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Note 11 - Summarized Financial Information of Joint Ventures:</font></font></b></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p align="left" style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">A summary of

combined operations of joint ventures in which the Company is a partner is as

follows:</font></font></p>

<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p align="left" style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company

performs some administrative services and provides operation and maintenance of

management information systems to some of these joint ventures.&#160; These administrative charges totaled $0.1

million in 2001, and $0.2 million in each of fiscal years 2000 and 1999.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Advances from and to joint venture partnerships from the

Company are included in noncurrent assets and liabilities above. Certain advances

bear interest at the prime rate less two percent.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Note 12 &#150; Disposal and Sale of Assets:</font></font></b></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">In fiscal 2000, the Company and its outside board members

approved the sale by a related party of a ship used by the Company to export

recycled metal.&#160; The sale resulted in a

$1.0 million loss.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">In fiscal 1999, Cascade Steel Rolling Mills, Inc. sold

its Union City, California mill depot recognizing a gain of $1.2 million which

is included in other income in the accompanying consolidated statement of

operations.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1 -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

</font></font></b>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Note 13 - Quarterly Financial Data (Unaudited) (in thousands,

except per share amounts):</font></font></b></p>

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:.92%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">$</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:10.52%;">

  <p align="right" style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">0.23</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:1.96%;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>

<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman"><font style="color:black;font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">of Schnitzer Steel Industries, Inc.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 4.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p align="left" style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our audits of the consolidated

financial statements referred to in our report dated September 28, 2001

appearing in this Form 10-K also included an audit of the financial statement

schedule listed in Item 14(a)(2) of this Form 10-K.&#160; In our opinion, this financial statement schedule presents

fairly, in all material respects, the information set forth therein when read

in conjunction with the related consolidated financial statements.</font></font></p>

<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><a name="Item10_DirectorsAndExecutiveOfficer"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">ITEM

<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Information regarding directors is included under

Annual Meeting of Shareholders and is incorporated herein by reference.&#160; Information with respect to executive

officers of the Company is included under Item 4(a) of Part I of this

Report.&#160; Information required by Item 405

of Regulation S-K is included under &#147;Section 16(a) Beneficial Ownership

Reporting Compliance&#148; in the Company's Proxy Statement for its 2002 Annual

Meeting of Shareholders and is incorporated herein by reference.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>

<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><a name="Item11_ExecutiveCompensation"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">ITEM

11.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION</font></font></a></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">The information required by this item is included under

Participation&#148; in the Company's Proxy Statement for its 2002 Annual Meeting of

Shareholders and is incorporated herein by reference.</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>

<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><a name="Item12_SecurityOwnershipOfCertainB"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">ITEM

12.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; SECURITY OWNERSHIP OF

CERTAIN BENEFICIAL OWNERS AND MANAGEMENT</font></font></a></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Information with respect to security ownership of certain

beneficial owners and management is included under &#147;Voting Securities and

Principal Shareholders&#148; in the Company's Proxy Statement for its 2002 Annual

Meeting of Shareholders and is incorporated herein by reference.</font></font></p>

13.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; CERTAIN RELATIONSHIPS

AND RELATED TRANSACTIONS</font></font></a></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></font></p>



<p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">The information required by this item is included under

&#147;Certain Transactions&#148; in the Company's Proxy Statement for its 2002 Annual

Meeting of Shareholders and is incorporated herein by reference.</font></font></p>

  </td>

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;width:2.12%;">

 <tr>

  <td valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;">

  <p align="right" style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;">&nbsp;</p>

  </td>

  <td valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt 2.9pt;">

  </td>

  <td valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt 2.9pt;">

  <p style="font-family:'Courier New';font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Addendum No. 4 to M/V Jade Pacific Uniform Time Charter

  Agreement</font></font></p>

  </td>

 </tr>

 <tr>

  <td valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt .7pt .7pt;">

  Trans-Pacific Shipping Co.&#160; Filed as

  Exhibit 10.2 to Registrant&#146;s Form 10-Q for the quarter ended November 30, 1997,

  and incorporated herein by reference.</font></font></p>
